column4: hi how i was wondering what is the best ubuntu tu use on my laptop i have a hp pavillion dv6768se with amd turion64x2 processer
should i use the i386 or amd
yeah but it is amd turion64x2
is there any difference on performance?
yeah my friend told me to run i386 because it is better for packages
how do i setup an atheros wifi connection dr willis can you help me please i want to get out of windows vista asap
my comp is loaded with junk and way slow now i need to get back to ubuntu
there are drivers that are not available for amd64 yet and some packages like flash are not available either,  unless you have a need for 64bit OS you are better off running the i386 for now
yes,  but you will need to do it from the live cd , you can'T resize a live partiton
you can do with 1 gig or less even
you are stating your case backward
